returnParameters.description: absolute value of parameter `x`

functions.name: abs
functions.description: Returns the IEEE absolute value of a float value.

returnParameters.description: the arccosine of parameter `x` in radians

functions.name: acos
functions.description:
Returns the arccosine of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE acos operation.

returnParameters.description: the arcsine of parameter `x` in radians

functions.name: asin
functions.description:
Returns the arcsine of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE asin operation.

returnParameters.description: the arctangent of parameter `x` in radians

functions.name: atan
functions.description:
Returns the arctangent of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE atan operation.

returnParameters.description:
the angle in radians from the positive x-axis to the point
whose Cartesian coordinates are `(x, y)`

functions.name: atan2
functions.description:
Performs the 2-argument arctangent operation.

Corresponds IEEE atan2(y, x) operation.

returnParameters.description: cube root of parameter `x`

functions.name: cbrt
functions.description:
Returns the cube root of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE rootn(x, 3) operation.

returnParameters.description: smallest (closest to -∞) decimal value not less than parameter `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: ceiling
functions.description: Rounds a float up to the closest integral value.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: float value, specifying an angle in radians

returnParameters.description: the cosine of parameter `x`

functions.name: cos
functions.description:
Returns the cosine of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE cos operation.

returnParameters.description: hyperbolic cosine of parameter `x`

functions.name: cosh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE cosh operation.

returnParameters.description: Euler's number raised to the power parameter `x`

functions.name: exp
functions.description:
Raises Euler's number to a power.

Corresponds to IEEE exp operation.

returnParameters.description: largest (closest to +∞) float value not greater than parameter `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: floor
functions.description: Rounds a float down to the closest integral value.

returnParameters.description: parameter `x` bit pattern as a float

functions.name: fromBitsInt
functions.description:
Returns the float that is represented in IEEE 64-bit floating point by an int.

All bit patterns that IEEE defines to be NaNs will all be mapped to the single float NaN value.

parameters.name: s
parameters.description: hexadecimal floating point hex string representation

returnParameters.description: float value or error

functions.name: fromHexString
functions.description:
Return the float value represented by a string.

parameter `s` must follow the syntax of HexFloatingPointLiteral as defined by the Ballerina specification
with the following modifications
- the HexFloatingPointLiteral may have a leading `+` or `-` sign
- `NaN` is allowed
- `Infinity` is allowed with an optional leading `+` or `-` sign

returnParameters.description: float value or error

functions.name: fromString
functions.description:
Returns the float value represented by a string.

parameter `s` must follow the syntax of DecimalFloatingPointNumber as defined by the Ballerina specification
with the following modifications
- the DecimalFloatingPointNumber may have a leading `+` or `-` sign
- `NaN` is allowed
- `Infinity` is allowed with an optional leading `+` or `-` sign
- a FloatingPointTypeSuffix is not allowed
This is the inverse of function `value:toString` applied to an `float`.

returnParameters.description: true if parameter `x` is finite, i.e., neither NaN nor +∞ nor -∞

functions.name: isFinite
functions.description:
Tests whether a float is finite.

Exactly one of isFinite, isInfinite and IsNaN will be true for any float value

returnParameters.description: true if parameter `x` is either +∞ or -∞

functions.name: isInfinite
functions.description:
Tests whether a float is infinite.

Exactly one of isFinite, isInfinite and IsNaN will be true for any float value

returnParameters.description: true if parameter `x` is NaN

functions.name: isNaN
functions.description:
Tests whether a float is NaN.

Exactly one of isFinite, isInfinite and IsNaN will be true for any float value.

returnParameters.description: natural logarithm of parameter `x`

functions.name: log
functions.description:
Returns the natural logarithm of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE log operation.

returnParameters.description: base 10 logarithm of parameter `x`

functions.name: log10
functions.description:
Returns the base 10 logarithm of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE log10 operation.

returnParameters.description: maximum value of all of parameter `xs`

functions.name: max
functions.description:
Returns the maximum of zero or more float values.

Result is -∞ if no args
NaN if any arg is NaN

returnParameters.description: minimum value of all of parameter `xs`

functions.name: min
functions.description:
Returns the minimum of zero or more float values.

Result is +∞ if no args
Result is NaN if any arg is NaN

returnParameters.description: `x` raised to the power of parameter `y`

functions.name: pow
functions.description:
Raises one float value to the power of another float values.

Corresponds to IEEE pow(x, y) operation.

returnParameters.description: closest float value to parameter `x` that is a mathematical integer

functions.name: round
functions.description:
Rounds a float value to the closest integral value.

Returns the float value that is a mathematical integer and closest to parameter `x`.
If there are two such values, choose the one that is even
(this is the round-to-nearest rounding mode, which is the default for IEEE and for Ballerina).
Same as Java Math.rint method
Same as .NET Math.Round method
IEEE roundToIntegralTiesToEven operation
Note that `<int>x` is the same as `<int>x.round()`

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: float value, specifying an angle in radians

returnParameters.description: the sine of parameter `x`

functions.name: sin
functions.description:
Returns the sine of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE sin operation.

returnParameters.description: hyperbolic sine of parameter `x`

functions.name: sinh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic sine of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE sinh operation.

returnParameters.description: square root of parameter `x`

functions.name: sqrt
functions.description:
Returns the square root of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE squareRoot operation.

returnParameters.description: sum of all of parameter `xs`, +0.0 if parameter `xs` is empty

functions.name: sum
functions.description:
Returns the sum of zero or more float values.

Result is NaN if any arg is NaN

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: float value, specifying an angle in radians

returnParameters.description: the tangent of parameter `x`

functions.name: tan
functions.description:
Returns the tangent of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE tan operation

returnParameters.description: hyperbolic tangent of parameter `x`

functions.name: tanh
functions.description:
Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a float value.

Corresponds to IEEE tanh operation.

returnParameters.description: parameter `x` bit pattern as an int

functions.name: toBitsInt
functions.description: Returns IEEE 64-bit binary floating point format representation of a float value as an int.

returnParameters.description: hexadecimal floating point hex string representation

functions.name: toHexString
functions.description:
Returns a string that represents a float value as a hexadecimal floating point number.

The returned string will comply to the grammar of HexFloatingPointLiteral
in the Ballerina spec with the following modifications:
- it will have a leading `-` sign if negative
- positive infinity will be represented by `Infinity`
- negative infinity will be represented by `-Infinity`
- NaN will be represented by `NaN`
The representation includes `0x` for finite numbers.

modules.summary: The `lang.float` module corresponds to basic type float.
modules.description:
## Module Overview

The `lang.float` module corresponds to basic type float.
The `lang.float` module corresponds to basic type float.
